actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services Discharged.
Miss Collins (MI) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Solomon objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.
Considered as unfinished business.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as Agreed to by recorded vote (2/3 required): 422 - 4 (Roll no. 442).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-385.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services

official_title: To designate the Federal building in Wichita Falls, Texas, which is currently known as the Main Post Office, as the "Graham B. Purcell, Jr., Post Office and Federal Building".

summary.text: Designates the Post Office building at 1000 Lamar Street, Wichita Falls, Texas, as the Graham B. Purcell, Jr., Post Office Building.

titles.title: To designate the Federal building in Wichita Falls, Texas, which is currently known as the Main Post Office, as the "Graham B. Purcell, Jr., Post Office and Federal Building".
